hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
source /home/test/.bashrc export Ansible_home=`pwd`
#Set the below parameters manually package_name="ansible" published_version="2.5.0"
#Check distro and available version in repo : rhel7.x, Sles11.x/12.x, Ub16.x/17.x . /etc/os-release if [ $ID == "rhel" ]; then available_version=$(sudo yum info $package_name | grep Version | head -1 | cut -d ':' -f 2| cut -d ' ' -f 2) elif [ $ID == "sles" ]; then available_version=$(sudo zypper info $package_name | grep Version | head -1 | cut -d ':' -f 2| cut -d ' ' -f 2) elif [ $ID == "ubuntu" ]; then available_version=$(sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-cache policy $package_name | grep Candidate | head -1 | cut -d ' ' -f 4) fi
echo $available_version
if [[ $available_version == *"$published_version"* ]]; then echo "Version $published_version is already available in repo" echo "Exact name: $available_version ... Failing" exit 1 else echo "Published version is not available in repo. Going ahead." fi
cd $Ansible_home rm -rf ansible #Install the dependencies sudo yum install -y git wget tar svn bzip2 unzip gcc python-devel make which autoconf net-tools ssh python-setuptools python-lxml python-ldap sqlite-devel openldap-devel libxslt-devel openssl-devel libffi-devel openssl systemd-devel python-memcached systemd ncurses-devel bzip2-devel zlib zlib-devel systemd-devel patch systemd-python.s390x patch libxml2-python.s390x
# Install Python 2.7.14 cd $Ansible_home sudo yum install -y gcc gcc-c++ make ncurses patch wget tar bzip2-devel zlib-devel xz xz-devel readline-devel sqlite-devel tk-devel ncurses-devel gdbm-devel openssl-devel db4-devel gdb wget https://www.python.org/ftp/python/2.7.14/Python-2.7.14.tar.xz tar -xvf Python-2.7.14.tar.xz cd Python-2.7.14 ./configure --prefix=/usr/local --exec-prefix=/usr/local make sudo make install export PATH=/usr/local/bin:$PATH sudo /usr/sbin/update-alternatives --install /usr/bin/python python /usr/local/bin/python 10 sudo /usr/sbin/update-alternatives --display python python -V
#Install certain Python modules for Ansible later on, pip is required: sudo env PATH=$PATH python -m ensurepip sudo env PATH=$PATH pip install --upgrade pip
#Get the source-code cd $Ansible_home git clone https://github.com/ansible/ansible.git cd ansible git checkout v2.5.0
#Setup the environment and get Ansible modules: source ./hacking/env-setup git submodule update --init --recursive source ./hacking/env-setup -q
#Ansible uses the following Python modules which need to be installed: sudo env PATH=$PATH python -m pip install paramiko PyYAML jinja2 httplib2 passlib nose mock mercurial six patch django==1.11.7 call coverage coveralls funcsigs cryptography==2.0.3 pycrypto boto3 botocore readline pytest-xdist pytest-mock boto redis s3 placebo netaddr pyVmomi xmljson f5-sdk packaging
#Install ansible sudo env PATH=$PATH make install
#Run tests make tests
ansible --version
